data.title: Nashua Pride have a big weekend planned
data.meta_description: NASHUA — The Nashua Pride have a full weekend of activities planned for their games at Holman Stadium as part of their Sports Fantasy Extravaganza Weekend. Tonight U.S. Senior Open champion Allen Doyle will be on hand and giving a free golf clinic before the game. Tomorrow Olympic champion skider Bode Miller and New England […]
data.text:
NASHUA — The Nashua Pride have a full weekend of activities planned for their games at Holman Stadium as part of their Sports Fantasy Extravaganza Weekend.

Tonight U.S. Senior Open champion Allen Doyle will be on hand and giving a free golf clinic before the game.

Tomorrow Olympic champion skider Bode Miller and New England Patriots tackle Matt Light will be on hand. Miller will play the first three innings of the game and Light will sing the National Anthem and coach first base.

Both will be available for autographs and the game will be followed by a fireworks display.

On Saturday NESN’s “Mad Fisherman” Charlie Moore will be filming his show from Holman Stadium.
